title: 14 day suspension
body:
Hello riot, I have read and understood that you don't appeal these bans however I feel that I this ban was wrongfully banned.

I understand the fact that my behavior was not in the right however my teammate was giving me an attitude towards me as he was clearly accusing me of my game play and my behavior towards the player led me to tilt.
While I did text "kys" and "%%%got" I believe that this ban was not reasonable as I have seem worse in game text.
Usually, I would never get this point I can deal with this type of behavior but this time I was not being myself.

Thanks and hopefully you could understand my point of vi

replies.body:
Ban appeals aren't done through the boards, but feel free to send a ticket into [Riot support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and ask to appeal your ban. Keep in mind that response times may be a little slow due to it being the holidays, but do not create multiple tickets as it does slow it down even further.

Punishments that are not given in error don't get lifted, and like others have stated you encouraged suicide and used homophobic language. These are two things that the community absolutely hates and have been pressuring Riot to act more harshly on. As a result, getting reported for this kind of language often skips you past the chat restricts straight to the 14 day ban.

While it is incredibly frustrating to have someone flame and start the chat war, it is important to remember that you are judged on your behavior and your behavior alone. It is a game that can definitely push you a over the edge if you are having a bad time/have been outmatched/have ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ s in your game, but there is never a reason to tell someone to end their lives or resort to hate speech.

While I agree that a 14 day ban may have been too harsh, "kys" shouldn't be said to a stranger that you've never met. You don't know if they've been contemplating death that day, you don't know if someone just broke up with them, you don't know anything about them so you don't have the right to suggest to someone to kill themselves just because they did badly at league. "%%%got" is just hate speech, nuff said.

Unfortantely ma man youll have to suck it up.. Any form of text where you have told someone to self harm is a huge no no...
Whether you were tilted or not, the /mute all is the best way to go in those situations..
I know its a rough deal and that you were prevoked but next time youll be better prepared for it and it wont happen again :)

Well this is just my 2 cents anyway :)
